title.narrative: Output: 1.2. Tanzania: Relevant state, business and civil society actors have strengthened capacity on and collaboration for implementation of the UNGPs.

description.narrative: Documentation from multi-stakeholder dialogues demonstrates collaborative actions forward on the salient business and human rights issues for the country that have been identified in the 2017 NBA and other business and human rights studies, including with focus on the energy and digital transitions. Select state, business and civil society actors have enhanced capacity to work towards NAP development and implementation.

title.narrative: Output: 1.2. Tanzania: Relevant state, business and civil society actors have strengthened capacity on and collaboration for implementation of the UNGPs.

description.narrative: Documentation from multi-stakeholder dialogues demonstrates collaborative actions forward on the salient business and human rights issues for the country that have been identified in the 2017 NBA and other business and human rights studies, including with focus on the energy and digital transitions. Select state, business and civil society actors have enhanced capacity to work towards NAP development and implementation.

comment.narrative: In Tanzania there is some existing engagement by state actors towards UNGPs implementation, e.g. an NBA was developed by the Tanzanian National Commission for Human Rights and Good Governance in 2017. There is also some advocacy and initiatives by civil society organisations and multilateral institutions (e.g., UNICEF) to mobilise state action on business and human rights.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: National-level implementation of the UNGPs in Ethiopia and Tanzania

description.narrative:
Key state actors in Ethiopia and Tanzania have embarked on a process to develop policy initiatives, such as national action plans, to implement the UNGPs.
Documentation of institutionalised steps, including uptake of tools and analysis, towards policy initiatives to implement the UNGPs.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: National-level implementation of the UNGPs in Ethiopia and Tanzania

description.narrative:
Key state actors in Ethiopia and Tanzania have embarked on a process to develop policy initiatives, such as national action plans, to implement the UNGPs.
Documentation of institutionalised steps, including uptake of tools and analysis, towards policy initiatives to implement the UNGPs.

comment.narrative: At the end of 2019, no Sub-Saharan African state has adopted a national action plan on business and human rights; two countries have made official commitments to develop one. In Tanzania, there is some existing engagement by state actors towards UNGPs implementation and in Ethiopia, engagement on business and human rights by state actors is just emerging.
